sentence.idiomatic: His home is nearby and we can see him along the way.
If you go to the bookstore could you buy a Chinese dictionary for me while you're there?
Could you buy dinner for me while you're out?
Can you check where the tire is leaking air from?
The tire is leaking air, I can't drive it.
Darn it, the tire is leaking air.
Your bicycle needs a new chain.
This bicycles' chain is loose.
The bicycle chain broke. What should we do?
The air conditioning here can automatically regulate the temperature in the room.
You can adjust the water temperature by pushing this button.
I will adjust the chain a little, and then you can ride it.
when it's at the evening, a lot of vendor stalls appear at the entrance.
He has set up a vendor stall nearby because he couldn't find a job.
Don't eat the food from the stalls, it's unsanitary.
Most of those that come to my shop are return customers.
The more return customers we have, the better our business will be.
Our business is mainly return customers.
Your cars' tire is flat.
What's wrong with your bikes' tire?
Please change the tire for me.
Sir, my bikes' tires are flat, could you pump some air for me? The front and back tire both needs air.
Sure, I can do it for you right now. You haven’t pump air in them in a long time, have you?
Yeah. While you’re at it, could you check it for me, to see if there are any other problems?
Sure. Look, your front tire is leaking air. There is a big hole here.
Oh, can you please patch it for me? Also, the chain is loose. When I’m riding it frequently falls off.
That’s simple, I will adjust it a little for you and it will be fine. See, just do this and it’s done. Ride it around a bit and see how it is.
Wow, there’s nothing wrong with it now. Your repair skills are really good!
Heh heh. I’ve had this little stall for years. All my business are return customers. Next time your bike needs repairing, remember to come to look for me.
